lexUnit.name: command.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: give an authoritative or peremptory order

sentence.text: The Fiend is an elemental entity of Evil from the Warp , which can be magically bound and commanded in various ways by powerful Evil wizards .
Do n't stop , " he commanded huskily as she lifted her head .
` Kneel down , " commanded the professor .
` Look at this skin ! " commands Dame Edna Everage , grabbing my hand for an exploratory stroke .
` Attention on the upper deck , " commanded the disembodied voice .
` Look at your hands ! " commanded Mr Broadhurst .
` Hold your tongue ! " commanded Lady Merchiston .
In fact Christ explicitly commanded his disciples to proclaim the Kingdom .
I commanded him to try and buy a George Paston .

This manoeuvre exposed the Russian Fifth Army 's flank to Auffenberg 's Fourth Army , still advancing northward , so Conrad commanded it to turn about and strike at the left flank of the Russian Third Army .
She was kidnapped by the storm god but the other gods commanded LOKI to retrieve her , for they all began to age rapidly without her supervision .
But time was when she could have commanded a grown man to do her errands and pay her debts . "
The artillery Colonel jerked round , stared at Rebecque for an instant , then bellowed his own orders , but instead of ordering a killing volley into the tall rye , he commanded his men to retreat .
The Master commands you to stay .
I command you to get well . "
The greatest love a man can have for his friends is to give his life for them and you are my friends , if you do what I command .
` Herein ! " a voice commanded from inside the office .
` Tell me you like it , Mademoiselle de Courmont , " he commanded , with a disdainful smile , ` tell me what it is you want .
" Get your hand higher up , " he commanded , tapping the boy 's knuckles with the cane .
` You will now tell me about your mission , " he commanded harshly .
` Now the shotgun , " he commanded , his glittering black eyes never leaving Grant 's .
` Open up , " he commanded , and fed her again .
Newspaper support of political parties is nowadays volunteered , it is not commanded .
The dog is commanded to sit and if he does n't do it the first time , he is pushed gently into position .
In 1255 the warden was commanded to pay the smith 25 marks a year out of the revenues of his bailiwick for 25,000 quarrels , which he was to keep safely for the king 's use .
So the Old Testament people were commanded to give a proportion of their talents and money to God as love offerings , thank offerings , sin offerings .
The people were commanded to assemble and were faced with a simple choice : ` Elijah stepped forward and said to the people , ` How long will you sit on the fence ?
When Andrewes died early in the next reign , King Charles commanded that his sermons be published .
The Pharisees had asked why Moses commanded that a man give his wife a certificate of divorce .
The centurion … commanded that they which could swim should cast themselves first into the sea and get to land .
